title: Pokédex
desc: A dashboard providing information on all generations of Pokémon. Search for any Pokémon and learn more about their stats, strengths, weaknesses and more.
learned: Working on this project taught me the benefits/drawbacks of using GraphQL over REST and how to scrape for missing data. The backend is a GraphQL API made using Apollo Server that connects to a MongoDB database. Through building the frontend I learned the various ways to use CSS in React (I chose styled-components) along with modern CSS patterns such as Flexbox and Grid.

title: Share Yourself Artists
desc: An art sharing platform where users can upload their artwork to share with others. Users can optionally purchase credits to have their artwork sponsored or simply use the free-tier.
learned: Project built as part of my Software Engineering course. I was responsible for configuring, building, and deploying the backend of the website. This involved setting up a cloud-hosted database, writing RESTful API's hosted on AWS Lambda, and enabling user authentication via AWS Cognito.

title: Startup Analysis
desc: Data Visualization project attempting to answer a number of questions about startup investments. Data was sourced from Crunchbase up to 2015.
learned: Through working on this project I learned how powerful and simple tools like Pandas and NumPy are for data analysis projects. The data visualization library Bokeh was chosen in order to make the visualizations interactive. This project has made me interested in working on more data visualization projects in the future, especially since I am now much more experienced with HTML/CSS.
